title: Machine learning enhanced vehicle merging
abstract: A method receives a first image set depicting a merging zone, the first image set including first image(s) associated with a first timestamp; determines, using a trained first machine learning logic, a first state describing a traffic condition of the merging zone at the first timestamp using the first image set; determines, from a sequence of states describing the traffic condition of the merging zone at a sequence of timestamps, using a trained second machine learning logic, second state(s) associated with second timestamp(s) prior to the first timestamp of the first state using a trained backward time distance; computes, using a trained third machine learning logic, impact metric(s) for merging action(s) using the first state, the second state(s), and the merging action(s); selects, from the merging action(s), a first merging action based on the impact metric(s); and provides a merging instruction including the first merging action to a merging vehicle.
claims:
1. A method comprising:
determining a merging action state in a sequence of states that indicates a merging action of a vehicle, the merging action state associated with a first timestamp;
determining, in the sequence of states, one or more backward states associated with one or more second timestamps prior to the first timestamp of the merging action state;
determining, in the sequence of states, one or more forward states associated with one or more third timestamps subsequent to the first timestamp of the merging action state;
determining an impact metric for the merging action and a target impact metric for the merging action; and
training machine learning logic based on the impact metric and the target impact metric.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein determining the one or more backward states associated with the one or more second timestamps includes determining the one or more backward states using a backward time distance.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein:
determining the impact metric for the merging action further comprises generating a feedback value from the impact metric and the target impact metric; and
training the machine learning logic further comprises adjusting the backward time distance based on the feedback value.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein determining the one or more forward states associated with the one or more third timestamps includes determining the one or more forward states using a forward time distance.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein:
determining the impact metric for the merging action further comprises generating a feedback value from the impact metric and the target impact metric; and
training the machine learning logic further comprises adjusting the forward time distance based on the feedback value.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the target impact metric for the merging action is determined based on one or more traffic condition aspects included in the one or more forward states.
7. The method of claim 6, wherein the one or more traffic condition aspects included in the one or more forward states comprise:
first vehicle movement data of one or more merging vehicles and first segment traffic data of an on-ramp segment;
second vehicle movement data of one or more upstream mainline vehicles and second segment traffic data of an upstream freeway segment;
third vehicle movement data of one or more downstream mainline vehicles and third segment traffic data of a downstream freeway segment; and
a merging time amount and a merging point position.
8. The method of claim 6, wherein the target impact metric for the merging action is further determined based on one or more weight values assigned to the one or more traffic condition aspects.
9. The method of claim 1, wherein determining the impact metric and the target impact metric further comprises:
determining the impact metric of the merging action based on the merging action state, the one or more backward states, and the merging action; and
determining the target impact metric for the merging action based on the one or more forward states.

one or more processors; and

determine a merging action state in a sequence of states that indicates a merging action of a vehicle, the merging action state associated with a first timestamp;

train machine learning logic based on the impact metric and the target impact metric.
11. The system of claim 10, wherein to determine the one or more backward states associated with the one or more second timestamps includes determining the one or more backward states using a backward time distance.
12. The system of claim 11, wherein:
to determine the impact metric for the merging action further comprises generating a feedback value from the impact metric and the target impact metric; and
to train the machine learning logic further comprises adjusting the backward time distance based on the feedback value.
13. The system of claim 10, wherein to determine the one or more forward states associated with the one or more second timestamps includes determining the one or more forward states using a forward time distance.
14. The system of claim 13, wherein:
to determine the impact metric for the merging action further comprises generating a feedback value from the impact metric and the target impact metric; and
to train the machine learning logic further comprises adjusting the forward time distance based on the feedback value.
15. The system of claim 10, wherein the target impact metric for the merging action is determined based on one or more traffic condition aspects included in the one or more forward states.
16. The system of claim 15, wherein the one or more traffic condition aspects included in the one or more forward states comprise:
first vehicle movement data of one or more merging vehicles and first segment traffic data of an on-ramp segment;
second vehicle movement data of one or more upstream mainline vehicles and second segment traffic data of an upstream freeway segment;
third vehicle movement data of one or more downstream mainline vehicles and third segment traffic data of a downstream freeway segment; and
a merging time amount and a merging point position.
17. The system of claim 15, wherein the target impact metric for the merging action is further determined based on one or more weight values assigned to the one or more traffic condition aspects.
18. The system of claim 10, wherein to determine the impact metric and the target impact metric further comprises:
determining the impact metric for the merging action based on the merging action state, the one or more backward states, and the merging action; and
determining the target impact metric for the merging action based on the one or more forward states.
19. A system comprising:

one or more memories storing:

20. The system of claim 19, wherein the impact calculator is further executable by the one or more processors to determine the impact metric and the target impact metric by:
